Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Alan Blaine of Temple Beth-El, 445 Beach 135th Street, Rockaway Park, New York.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Addabbo.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Alan Blaine of Temple Beth-El, 445 Beach 135th Street, Rockaway Beach, New York.

Council Member Addabbo moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Koppell:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 020013 PPX shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 3542 Webster Ave, Bronx (C020013PPX)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Sanders:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 20020078 ZSQ and 020079 PSQ shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Queens (020079PSQ & 20020078ZSQ)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Public Safety

Resolution calling upon the Department of Justice to approve the City's application for a waiver to continue to use funds for officer salaries for Fiscal Years 2003 and 2004 under the Community Oriented Policing Services (COPS) program, and urging both the United States Congress and the Department of Justice to amend program requirements to enable federal funds to continue to assist the New York City Police Department in its crime-fighting efforts.
Items.MatterName: Community Oriented Policing Services (COPS)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Federal Government to take all actions necessary, including amending the existing Federal Emergency Management Agency guidelines, to reimburse the New York City Police Department for all expenses related to the attack on the World Trade Center.
Items.MatterName: FEMA, Reimburse NYPD related to attack on WTC.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Standards and Ethics
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to annual disclosure of financial interests.

Items.MatterName: Annual disclosure of financial interests.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in order to clarify the express  authority  of the commissioner of parks and recreation to regulate the vending of written matter within the geographical areas under the jurisdiction of parks and recreation.
Items.MatterName: Clarify the express authority of the commissioner of parks and recreation ('"re: vending of written materials")

Items.Title: Resolution in support of "Bring Your Children to Work Day" to be held on April 25, 2002.
Items.MatterName: Bring Your Children to Work Day, April 25, 2002.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Montgomery, S.6410, and Assembly Member Boyland, A.10255, "AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired April 18, 1979 by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn, to the distributees or devisees of prior owner Frances Drakes as of April 29, 1972, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1658, Lot No. 76, section 6 on the tax map for the borough of Brooklyn ".
Items.MatterName: In rem, Frances Drakes, Brooklyn (S.6410, A.10255)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senators Connor, Brown, Gentile, Gonzalez, Hassell-Thompson, Hevesi, Kruger, Lachman, Mendez, Montgomery, Onorato, Oppenheimer, Paterson, Santiago, Schneiderman, A. Smith, M. Smith, Stachowski and Stavisky, S.6066, "AN ACT to amend chapter 576 of the laws of 1974, amending the emergency housing rent control law relating to the control of and stabilization of rent in certain cases, the emergency housing rent control law, chapter 329 of the laws of 1963, amending the emergency housing rent control law relating to recontrol of rents in the city of Albany, chapter 555 of the laws of 1982, amending the general business law and the administrative code of the city of New York relating to conversion of residential property to cooperative of condominium ownership in the city of New York, chapter 402 of the laws of 1983, amending the general business law relating to conversion of rental residential property to cooperative or condominium ownership in certain municipalities in the counties of Nassau, Westchester and Rockland, and the rent regulation reform act of 1997, in relation to their periods of effectiveness, and repealing certain provisions of the emergency housing rent control law, the emergency tenant protection act of nineteen seventy four and the administrative code of  the city of New York relating to regulation of housing".
Items.MatterName: Amending the emergency housing rent control law relating to the control of and stabilization of rent in certain cases (S.6066).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.6760, and Assembly Members Abbate, Seddio, Cymbrowitz and Lavelle, et al, A.10470, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the application of the age fifty-seven retirement program, the mandated physically taxing program and the incumbent fifty-five/twenty-five program for certain employees".
Items.MatterName: Application of the age fifty-seven retirement program, mandated physically taxing program, incumbent fifty-five/twenty-five program (S.6760, A.10470)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Trunzo, S.6242, and Assembly Member Eddington, et al, A.5910-A, "AN ACT to amend chapter 769 of the laws of 1975, relating to membership in public retirement systems or pension plans for certain persons employed in transitional public employment service, in relation to credit for such transitional employment".
Items.MatterName: Membership in public retirement systems, pension plans for certain persons employed in transitional public employment service (S.6242, A.5910-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Abbate, Lavelle, Cymbrowitz and Seddio, et al, A.10199, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to member contributions to a public retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Member contributions to a public retirement system (A.10199)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Leibell, S.2847, and Assembly Member Vitaliano, et al, A.5386, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to member contributions to a public retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Member contributions to a public retirement system (S.2847, A.5386)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Morahan, Balboni, Bonacic, DeFrancisco, Fuschillo, Hoffman, Johnson, Larkin, Lavalle, Maltese, Marcellino, Marchi, Maziarz, McGee, Nozzolio, Padavan, Rath, Seward, Spano, Trunzo, Velella, Volker and Wright, S.2329-A, and Assembly Members Tocci, Lavelle, Clark, Colman, Ortiz and Weisenberg, et al, A.9839, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, the education law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to supplemental military retirement allowances for members of public retirement systems of the state".
Items.MatterName: Supplemental military retirement allowances for members of public retirement systems of the state (S.2329-A, A.9839)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Maziarz, Alesi, Bonacic, DeFrancisco, Farley, Lack, Larkin, Maltese, McGee, Morahan, Padavan, Rath, Seward, Velella and Volker, S.3365-A, and Assembly Members Sweeney, Tonko, Weisenberg, Canestrari, Jacobs, Sidikman and Colton, et al, A.4190-A, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the employment of retired persons".
Items.MatterName: Employment of retired persons (S.3365-A, A.4190-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan, Espada and Velella, S.7118, and Committee on Rules, A.11011, "AN ACT repealing certain provisions of the emergency housing rent control law, the emergency tenant protection act of nineteen seventy four and the administrative code of the city of New York relating to regulation of housing".
Items.MatterName: Repealing certain provisions of the emergency housing rent control law, the emergency tenant protection act (S.7118, A.11011)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan, Espada, Marchi and Velella, S.7112, and Committee on Rules, A.11010, "AN ACT to amend chapter 576 of the laws of 1974, amending the emergency housing rent control law relating to the control of and stabilization of rent in certain cases, the emergency housing rent control law, chapter 329 of the laws of 1963, amending the emergency housing rent control law relating to recontrol of rents in the city of Albany, chapter 555 of the laws of 1982, amending the general business law and the administrative code of the city of New York relating to conversion of residential property to cooperative or condominium ownership in the city of New York, chapter 402 of the laws of 1983, amending the general business law relating to conversion of rental residential property to cooperative or condominium ownership in certain municipalities in the counties of Nassau, Westchester and Rockland, and the rent regulation reform act of 1997, in relation to their periods of effectiveness ".
Items.MatterName: Amending the emergency housing rent control law relating to the control of and stabilization of rent in certain cases (S.7112, A.11010)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Abbate, Lavelle, Cymbrowitz and Seddio, et al, A.10281, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to member benefit calculation formulas".
Items.MatterName: Member benefit calculation formulas (A.10281)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Committee on Rules, A.9029-A, "AN ACT to amend the education law, the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing members of a public retirement system to obtain retirement service credit for certain periods of child care leave".
Items.MatterName: Allowing members of a public retirement system to obtain retirement service credit for certain periods of child care leave (A.9029-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Abbate, Cymbrowitz, Seddio, Lavelle and Pheffer, et al, A.10200, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the definitions of final average salary".
Items.MatterName: Definitions of final average salary (A.10200)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Velella, S.5495-A, and Assembly Members Abbate, Lavelle, Cymbrowitz and Seddio, et al, A.10283, "AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to establishing a variable supplements fund for members of the New York city board of education retirement system".
Items.MatterName: Establishing a variable supplements fund for members of the New York city board of education retirement system (S.5495-A, A.10283)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Spano. S.3068-A, and Assembly Members Abbate, McEneny, Seddio, Cymbrowitz and Lavelle, et al, A.10360, "AN ACT to amend chapter 677 of the laws of 1977, amending the civil service law relating to the rights extended by a public employer to an employee organization in certain cases, chapter 678 of the laws of 1977, amending the civil service law relating to the rights of a public employee organization and chapter 606 of the laws of 1992, amending the civil service law and the general municipal law relating to rights extended by a public employer to an employee organization in certain cases, in relation to eliminating the expiration of certain provisions thereof".
Items.MatterName: Amending the civil service law relating to the rights extended by a public employer to an employee organization in certain cases (S.3068-A, A.10360)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Leibell and Nozzolio, S.2945-C, and Assembly Members McEneny, Canestrari and M. Cohen, et al, A.5558-C, "AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to benefits of members subject to article 11 and article 15 who retire prior to the normal retirement age with twenty-five years of service".
Items.MatterName: Benefits of members subject to article 11 and article 15 who retire prior to the normal retirement age with twenty-five years of service (S.2945-C, A.5558-C)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City Council to declare its support for plaintiffs Deadria Farmer-Paellmann, Mary Lacey Madison, Andrea Carrington and all others similarly situated, in their efforts to seek restitution in a federal class action suit brought against the corporations that are alleged to have participated in and directly profited from the abhorrent institution of slavery.
Items.MatterName: Slavery, Restitution and Class Action Suit

Items.Title: Resolution calling for an evenhanded policy in the Middle East and a halt to the killings of innocent Palestinians and Israelis; calling upon the City Council to serve as facilitators of peace and not to appear to take sides in the conflict; recognizing that just as the Council supports Israel's right to exist with safe and secure borders, so too must the Council support Palestinian self-determination and the creation of a Palestinian state; and emphatically stating that only through dialogue and peaceful negotiation can these historic conflicts be resolved.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Calling for an evenhanded policy in the Middle East.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State legislature to pass Resolution No. K2249 urging the Congress of the United States to enact legislation eliminating wage discrimination thereby enhancing the opportunity for women to achieve full equality
Items.MatterName: Eliminate wage discrimination (K2249)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of tax liens and in rem foreclosure actions on class 1 properties and class 2 properties that are residential condominiums or residential cooperatives and have been deemed abandoned.
Items.MatterName: Sale of tax liens.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing penalties for violating the housing maintenance code by failing to provide adequate heat and hot water.
Items.MatterName: Increase penalty for violating the housing maintenance code, failing to provide heat and hot water.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress to adopt and the President to enact legislation which would promote greater parity in the provision of mental health services.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Greater parity in the provision of mental health services.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Legislature of the State of New York to amend the Real Property Tax Law to provide rent increase exemptions to qualified disabled heads of households modeled on the Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption (SCRIE) program.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption (SCRIE) program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Legislature of the State of New York to enact legislation to regulate staffing and training standards in nursing homes in New York State.
Items.MatterName: Nursing Homes, Regulate Staffing and Training

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact a "Second Chance" rehabilitation program of civic service, education and job training to assist non-violent felony offenders in reintegrating successfully into society.
Items.MatterName: Second chance rehabilitation program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council of the City of New York to conduct a hearing on the plan of Chief Judge Judith Kaye of the New York State Court of Appeals to offer nonviolent drug-addicted offenders the choice of undergoing drug treatment rather than incarceration.
Items.MatterName: Nonviolent drug-addicted offenders

Items.Title: A Resolution calling upon the Legislature and the Governor of New York to amend Article 18-B of the State County Law and Section 35 of the Judiciary Law to increase the hourly compensation paid to attorneys who represent economically disadvantaged persons as court-appointed counsel in Family Court and Criminal Court, and further exhorting the Legislature and the Governor to provide state funding for the fee increase so as to ensure that the State of New York meets its constitutional and statutory duty to provide appropriate legal representation to persons involved in such proceedings.
Items.MatterName: Amend Article 18-B of the State County Law & Section 35 of the Judiciary Law.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States to hold fact-finding hearings to establish and define the bases and justifications for the government of the United States to pay reparations to African-American descendants of African ancestors who were held in slavery in this country, and its original colonies, between 1619 and 1865.
Items.MatterName: Reparations to African-American Decendants, Hearing

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the General Municipal Law to allow New York City to create a Voluntary Service Award Program for the City's Auxiliary Police Officers.
Items.MatterName: Create a Voluntary Service Award Program for City Auxiliary Police Officers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate Committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold a hearing on the list of "demands and requests" put forth by the National Action Network's ACS Committee on how to more fairly resolve grievances made by families regarding the procedures and decisions rendered by the New York City Administration for Children's Services.
Items.MatterName: List of "demands and requests" put forth by the National Action Network's ACS Committee, Hearing

Items.Title: Resolution calling for the appointment of a special federal prosecutor to investigate alleged human rights violations, wrongful removals, and unconstitutional practices against children and their families by the New York City Administration for Children's Services and its contracted agencies, and to investigate the New York Family Court System for violation of the United States Court of Appeals ruling that "it is unconstitutional for the Administration for Children's Services to remove children from their parents' custody without a court order unless there is an imminent risk of harm."
Items.MatterName: Appointment of a special federal prosecutor to investigate alleged human rights violations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the design and construction of private water mains.
Items.MatterName: Design and construction of private water mains.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the transportation, conveyance or removal of materials, waste and debris from Ground Zero, the site of the former World Trade Center.
Items.MatterName: Transportation, conveyance or removal of materials, waste and debris from Ground Zero.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing an analysis of the effect of the World Trade Center attacks on public health.
Items.MatterName: Providing an analysis of the effect of the WTC attacks on public health.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York City, in relation to air quality control.
Items.MatterName: Air quality control.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the number of deputy commissioners in the department of investigation.
Items.MatterName: Number of deputy commissioners in the department of investigation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Board of Education to mandate that all school children in grade five or lower be required to remain at school until a parent or authorized person of responsible age picks them up.
Items.MatterName: Mandate that children be picked up by parent or authorized person.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to approve, A.11010/S.7112, in relation to extending state rent regulation and eviction protection laws and A.11011/S.7118, in relation to repealing high-rent vacancy decontrol.
Items.MatterName: Repealing high-rent vacancy decontrol.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York City Police Department to collect and report data regarding arrests arising out of domestic incidents.
Items.MatterName: NYPD to collect & report data regarding arrests, domestic incidents.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a fixed buffer zone around reproductive health care facilities.
Items.MatterName: Establishing a buffer zone around reproductive health care facilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the New York City Council to hold a hearing on the policy of each of the City's District Attorneys regarding domestic violence complaints.
Items.MatterName: Oversight Hearing, Domestic Violence Complaints

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the New York City Council to conduct hearings on the Police Department's rules regarding press pass distribution to the media.
Items.MatterName: Police Department's rules regarding press pass distribution to the media, Hearing

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold a hearing on the policies and practices of the New York City Police Department's Office of Equal Employment Opportunity.
Items.MatterName: Policies and practices of the NYPD's Office of Equal Employment Opportunity, Hearing

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the New York City Council to investigate the quality and effectiveness of operating equipment and bilingual translators for the City's E-911 system.
Items.MatterName: Investigate the quality and effectiveness of operating equipment and bilingual translators for the City's E-911 system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the appropriate Committee of the City Council to hold an oversight hearing on the New York City Police Department's policies regarding substance and alcohol abuse by its members and what programs are available for officers in need of assistance and treatment.
Items.MatterName: NYPD's policies regarding substance and alcohol abuse by its members, Hearing

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold hearings to investigate the nature and extent of the resources and special support the Boy Scouts of America receives from the City of New York and/or its uniformed forces, and explore whether such resources would be better spent on organizations that do not discriminate based on sexual orientation.
Items.MatterName: Boy Scouts of America, Hearing

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council to hold an oversight hearing on compliance by the New York City Housing Authority with Section Three of the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) regulations related to providing economic opportunities generated by HUD resources to residents of public housing and other low-income persons.
Items.MatterName: Providing economic opportunities generated by HUD resources to residents of public housing and other low-income persons.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting Assembly bill A.07082, which would amend the Criminal Procedure Law to require that, prior to the acceptance of a guilty plea, New York State courts advise individuals, who are not United States citizens, that a plea of guilty may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to the United States, or denial of naturalization.
Items.MatterName: Amending Criminal Procedure Law

Items.Title: Resolution in support of Assembly Bill 7105 to provide additional compensation to employees of the New York City Police Department who speak or utilize a foreign language in the performance of their duties.
Items.MatterName: Provide additional compensation to employees of the NYPD who speak or utilize a foreign language in the performance of their duties.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the City Council to hold hearings on the progress of New York City and New York State in improving responses to possible terrorist attacks on New York City.
Items.MatterName: Progress of NYC and NYS in improving responses to possible terrorist attacks on NYC, Hearing

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to penalties for recycling violations.
Items.MatterName: Penalties for recycling violations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to public awareness city-wide of energy conservation measures through the department of environmental protection.
Items.MatterName: Public awareness city-wide of energy conservation measures.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the operation, standing or parking of mobile billboards.
Items.MatterName: Mobile Billboards, Prohibit

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requirements for high performance buildings.
Items.MatterName: Requirements for high performance buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to the procurement of energy efficient products.
Items.MatterName: Procurement of energy efficient products.

Items.Title: Resolution strongly condemning the brutal Palestinian suicide bomb terrorist attacks against Israel and expressing solidarity with the people of the State of Israel as well as sympathy for the loss of civilian lives in the current conflict.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Condemning the Palestinian suicide bomb terrorist attacks.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt meaningful reform of the Rockefeller drug laws, which should include, among its elements, judicial sentencing discretion, a decrease in the amount of prison time for certain types of drug offenses, an increase in the amount of narcotics required to secure certain convictions, adequate funding of alternative to incarceration programs, and stiffer penalties for drug trafficking.
Items.MatterName: Reforming Rockefeller drug laws.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to strengthening and clarifying the Campaign Finance Act.
Items.MatterName: Strengthening and clarifying the campaign finance act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt A. 2006, which would enhance health coverage for women.
Items.MatterName: Enhance health coverage for women (A.2006)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress and the United States Small Business Administration (SBA) to develop effective programs to provide much needed relief to businesses in New York City in the wake of the September 11th attacks and further calling upon the United States Congress to adopt measures such as those contained in S.1499 and H.R.3230, which would increase the number of small businesses eligible for financial relief from the SBA.
Items.MatterName: Small Business Administration to develop programs to help NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that commercial film and photographic print processors report child pornography to law enforcement officials.
Items.MatterName: Reporting of Child Pornography

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the Smoke-Free Air Act of 1995 to prohibit smoking in restaurants, regardless of seating capacity, in private offices when more than its occupant is present, and in city owned vehicles.
Items.MatterName: Amending the Smoke-Free Air Act of 1995

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City Charter to give the Civilian Complaint Review Board the authority to prosecute cases.
Items.MatterName: Amend the Charter to give the CCRB the authority to prosecute cases.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the civil penalties for violations of section 17-620 of such code prohibiting the sale of tobacco products to minors.
Items.MatterName: Prohbiit sale of tobacco product to minors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a comprehensive policy for city employees regarding domestic violence and the workplace.
Items.MatterName: Establishing a comprehensive policy for city employees regarding domestic violence and the workplace.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature and Governor to enact legislation that would reverse the potential 20% increases that are allowed each time an apartment becomes vacant and would repeal the decontrol of units that reach $2000 per month in rent.
Items.MatterName: Rent Control Amendments, State Action

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Division of Housing and Community Renewal to amend the Rent Stabilization Code to require that rent increases granted by the Division of Housing and Community Renewal for the cost of a new new refrigerator or new stove be eliminated upon the landlord's total recoupment of such disbursement.
Items.MatterName: Rent Increases, Refrigerator or Stove

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing the many contributions to our City, our communities, and our cultural and civic life made by New Americans from the Former Soviet Union.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Recognizing New Americans from the Former Soviet Union.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to changing the name of the organized crime control commission to the business integrity commission.
Items.MatterName: Changing the name of the organized crime control commission to the business integrity and anticorruption commission.

Items.Title: A Local La to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to defective trouble lights.
Items.MatterName: For-hire Vehicles, Defective Trouble Lights

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature and Governor to set aside $14.5 million annually from the New York State Attendance Improvement/Dropout Prevention (AIDP) program to Community Based Organizations (CBO's) for the Community Achievement Project in the Schools (CAPS) program.
Items.MatterName: Community Achievement Project in the Schools (CAPS) program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an application to revise the boundaries of the South Jamaica empire zone.
Items.MatterName: Revise boundaries of the South Jamaica Empire zone.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an application to revise the boundaries of the North Shore empire zone.
Items.MatterName: Revise boundaries of the North Shore Empire zone.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Lower Manhattan Development Corporation and the Empire State Development Corporation to allocate discretionary funds to provide income support to New Yorkers throughout the city who lost their jobs or whose hours of employment were reduced as a result of the September 11 attack.
Items.MatterName: Allocate discretionary funds to NYer's effected by 9/11.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact a further extension of unemployment insurance and calling upon the United States Congress to extend and expand unemployment assistance benefits.
Items.MatterName: Further extension of unemployment insurance.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to annual disclosure of financial interests.
Items.MatterName: Annual disclosure of financial interests.

Items.Title: Resolution admonishing the Board of Regents of the University of the State of New York (the "Board of Regents") for "breaking tradition" by failing to elect to the position of Chancellor the incumbent Vice Chancellor, as has been the tradition of the Board of Regents, and requesting that the Board of Regents explain to the New York State Legislature, all statewide educational organizations, and to all New Yorkers why they neglected to follow this tradition and to seize the opportunity presented to them to elevate to the position of Chancellor, incumbent Vice Chancellor Sanford, a visionary and committed educational leader who has worked tirelessly on behalf of all the children of the State of New York to provide them with a quality education through the state's public school system.
Items.MatterName: Admonishing the Board of Regents, University of the State of New York  for "breaking tradition" regarding Vice Chancellor Sanford.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to the installation of illegal window gates.
Items.MatterName: Window Gates, Illegal

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to defining who may submit complaints regarding inspections of one- or two-family dwellings and increasing the penalty for refusing to allow access for inspection of such dwellings.
Items.MatterName: Inspections Complaints Dwellings

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to requiring the New York city fire department to submit to the city council an operational time analysis report summarizing departmental performance with respect to calls for emergency assistance.
Items.MatterName: Fire Department, Emergency Assisstance Report

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a study of multi-faceted sports stadia for economic development and to recommend a plan for improved community and amateur sports facilities.
Items.MatterName: Study of multi-faceted sports stadia for economic development.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a traffic island name, Frank LoCicero Bellerose - Hillside Civic Garden, Borough of Queens.
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Frank LoCicero Bellerose-Hillside Civic Garden, Queens.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter in relation to public hearings for contract renewals.
Items.MatterName: Public hearings for contract renewals.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor and the Fire Department to drop its proposal to eliminate ambulance tours provided by City ambulances, to stop increasing the number of voluntary hospital ambulance tours, and to stop subsidizing voluntary hospitals that participate in the 911 system.
Items.MatterName: Eliminate Ambulance Tours

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt, and the Governor to sign into law, the Geriatric and Older Prisoner Act of 2001.
Items.MatterName: Geriatric and Older Prisoner Act of 1997

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to amend the Penal Law to classify assaults on New York City traffic enforcement agents as a felony.
Items.MatterName: Classify assaults on NYC traffic enforcement agents a felony.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Miller) made the following announcements

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Miller), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on May 8, 2002.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Application no. 20025369 HAM, an Urban Development Action Area Project known as Harlem Central II, located in Community Boards 10 and 11, Council Districts no. 8 and 9, Borough of Manhattan.  This matter is subject to Council review and action pursuant to Article 16 of the New York General Municipal Law, at the request of the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development, and pursuant to Section 696 of the General Municipal Law for an exemption from real property taxes.
Items.MatterName: UDAAP, Harlem Central II, Manhattan (20025369HAM)

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Passed The Consent Agenda
